snippet: As Mitt Romney has emerged as the Republican Party’s presumptive nominee, most of his rivals have ended up in debt that is not easily paid off.
abstract: Many of Mitt Romney's Republican presidential rivals have emerged from the contest in significant debt, and some with tarnished political reputations; phenomenon belies common wisdom that even a failed presidential bid can increase a candidate's name recognition, pave the way to lucrative speaking fees and help with a re-election effort.
lead_paragraph: As Mitt Romney has emerged as the Republican Party’s presumptive nominee, most of his rivals have ended up in debt that is not easily paid off.

headline.main: After Primary Losses, Legacies of Debt and Strained Reputations
headline.print_headline: After Primary Losses, Legacies of Debt and Strained Reputations
